qas.question: What is the name for a form of oxygen in which electrons are paired?
To what is singlet oxygen more reactive?
In what process is singlet oxygen usually formed?
By what process is singlet oxygen made in the tropophere?

answers.text: photolysis of ozone by light of short wavelength
photolysis of ozone by light of short wavelength

qas.question: What objects in organisms absorb singlet oxygen to prevent harm?
What is formed in nature from energy during photosynthesis?
What plays a major role in absorbing oxygen?

context:
<a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4><b5_0>Singlet<a0_3/><a0_0/> oxygen<b5_0/><a0_4/><a0_2/><a0_1/> is a name given to several higher-energy species of molecular O
2 in which all the electron spins are paired. It is much more reactive towards <a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4>common <a1_0>organic molecules<a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> than is molecular oxygen per se. In nature, singlet oxygen is commonly formed from water during <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4>photosynthesis<a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, using the energy of sunlight. It is also produced <b7_0>in the troposphere<b7_0/> by the <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><a3_4>photolysis<a3_4/> of ozone<a3_1/><a3_0/> by light of short wavelength<a3_3/><a3_2/>, and by the immune system as a source of active oxygen. <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><a4_4><b8_0>Carotenoids<a4_4/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> in photosynthetic organisms<b8_0/> (and possibly also in animals) play a major role in absorbing energy from singlet oxygen and converting it to the unexcited ground state before it can cause harm to tissues.
